WA.message: Born and raised in Seattle.  Growing up in the emerald city i have a deep appreciation for nature and our place within it.  The booming tech world, particularly in Seattle has shown me first hand the impact technology can have on our lives.  I hope to make it a good one!

OR.message: Frequently driven thruough and a festive new years celebration in 2019-2020.

CA.message: I loved to Claremont CA to attend Pitzer College.  While I studied Physics the interdicuplinary nature of the school engaged my desire to talk pholosophy and politics with friends

ID.message: Moved to Ketchum Idaho for the summer through spring of 2020-2021.  There I were the humble beginnings of both my interest in web development and living in a ski town!  While remote working for Los Alamos National Lab I grew an interest for the web application development I was working on and began to persue this as a career path.

NV.message: In 2021 while driving across the state, I happened across a beautiful hot spring in the middle of no where!

AZ.message: Another state driven through.  Sedona inspired beautiful dreams and warm hikes.

UT.message: The site of many a drive through and the occasional week long stay.  From skiing in the Salt Lake area to biking slick rock in Moab, Utah has a special place in my heart.

MT.message: I accompanied my brother on a roadtrip through montana when was in college and gawked at the untouched nature all around me.

CO.message: In 2021 I decided to persue my life long desire to move and work in a ski town.  While taking time off coding I learned entirely new skills of bartending and skiing down double black mountains.  The second season I was in Colorado I took on yet another new position of ski technician.  In these two years I gained invaluable skills working with people every day and finding a balance between working hard and playing hard.

NM.message: In the fall of 2019 I moved to New Mexico with the intension of living there for years to come with my new shiny- post grad job.  In the ensuing few months I dove into testing and building data processing suites.  I also dove into New Mexico's Thatch Green Chili sauce.  Before I was able to really get into the swing of things, covid-19 hit, and I high-tailed it out of there to be with family and friends during the next few years.  The high desert and magnificent mountains are still constantly on my mind.

SD.message: Roadtripped with my brother to Badlands National park.

KS.message: Drove throguh on my way east, and I think there is more to see.

OK.message: Never been, but I have seen the classic play which goes down with imfamy in my family.

TX.message: Only ever flown through the Dallas Fortwarth Airport.  Whole lot to explore there!

AR.message: Drove through just a corner. I hear there is some great mountain biking in these parts.

MO.message: Stayed the night on a road trip.  It was pouring rain.  I also saw two horse drawn carrages on the side of the highway.

WI.message: As my grandparents home state, I have been lucky enouhg to explore the madison area.  There is somehitng pretty special about drinking a beer at the student union on the lake in late June.

IL.message: With my parents and brother attending college in the Chicago area, I have been to the bean.

MI.message: Drove through to see my fam.  Gotta love the midwestern feels.

IN.message: Drove through Gary and it was stinky.

TN.message: Visited Nashville to see a friend perform.  A gorgous summer night was the perfect introduction to the city.

MS.message: Slipped through the north east corner on a roadtrip but I want to float that river!

AL.message: Driving through the south was a real novelty for someone from the PNW.  Going though cities like Montgomery and Selma was like driving through history.

FL.message: With my grandparents taking up residency on the gulf coast I've had the pleasure of humid days spent at the beaches.  In 2013 I went parasailing off the back of a boat there!

GA.message: My path was unexpectaly drawn to Georgia with Ada Developers Academy in the winter of 2023.  At Ada I learned all the tech stacks I was missing while at LANL.  With a bolstered knowledge of full stack web developemnt I was able to create this web site!  While my time in Atlanta was brief, it was full of beautiful people and lovely biking.

VA.message: The site of my parents late 20's we have been back to visit the DC area a number of times.  Though the legends of heat and bitter cold have been enough to keep me off the eastern seaboard thus far.

MD.message: Visiting the surrounding DC area, I have diped into the baltimore area a few times.  Nothing to report.

DC.message: It's cool to see the govermnent of the US at work.  In 2009 I was lucky enough to get to attend the Inaguration of Barak Obama.  At only 12 years old it was impressed upon me the weight of the moment, baring witenss to a historic moment.  Since then politics and govenment have always held an important place in my life.

NJ.message: Newark is NOT New York, but it is very close. -- Wisdome from me traveling through Newark Airport

NY.message: An early spring college tour of New York State proved to disswade me from attending any of the schools up there as it was quite cold and didnt stand a chance next to Southern California's alure.  In 2021 I made my way to the big Apple for the first time in my life.  A month spent walking all of manhattan and into Brooklyn and Queens left an impression of the diversity and bustling nature of the east coast.

CT.message: I have family who lives in rural Connecticut.  The trees and quaintness of new england always feel like home when I come back.

MA.message: Coming from the west coast, in the eyes of a child, the cobblestone streets of Boston seemed ancient.

NH.message: Childhood summer vacations spent at my grandparents cabin on Crystal were magic, always accompanied by a gigantic serving of icecream.  This starting me on my adventrue towards veganism.

VT.message: Visited the Ben & Jerry's factory and got a cool t-shirt

ME.message: A family reunion cerca 2006 brought me to Bar Harbor.  I ate some lobster.

RI.message: I rolled through Rhode Island for a sailing trip in early september 2021.  Gave off classic new england vibes.  A little out of my west coast comfort zone.

AK.message: I visited as a young child and went to a lumberjack show.  I still have the slice of wood they gave me!

HI.message: A couple of highly coveded vacations took me to Hawaii and Maui.  On Maui I took on an epic bike around the north side of the island.  Stopped for some banana bread and coconut candy, IYKYK.
